snippet: A lawsuit says that New York City police officers routinely stop black and Latino men without cause and then charge them with low-level misdemeanors when small amounts of marijuana are found.
abstract: Federal civil right lawsuit to be filed in Manhattan court on behalf of five Bronx men contends that New York City police officers routinely stop black and Latino men without cause and charge them with low-level misdemeanors when their pockets are emptied and small amounts of marijuana are found; lawsuit holds that officers falsely claim that marijuana is in public view.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit says that New York City police officers routinely stop black and Latino men without cause and then charge them with low-level misdemeanors when small amounts of marijuana are found.

headline.seo: 5 in Bronx Contend Police Distorted Marijuana Searches to Create Misdemeanors
headline.main: Federal Suit Claims Police Distort Marijuana Searches to Create Misdemeanors
headline.print_headline: Federal Suit Claims Police Distorted Marijuana Searches to Create Misdemeanors
